class.name: Word.Document
class.description: The Document object is the top level object. A Document object contains one or more sections, content controls, and the body that contains the contents of the document.

properties.name: activeWindow
properties.description: Gets the active window for the document.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the page index, total number of paragraphs, and first paragraph text for each page in the active document window.
Get the name and path of the template attached to the current document
Enable automatic hyphenation for the entire document to improve text flow and reduce spacing issues in justified paragraphs
Check if AutoSave is currently enabled for the document and display the status to the user
Get the bibliography from the document and access its title property to display it in the console.

properties.name: body
properties.description: Gets the body object of the main document. The body is the text that excludes headers, footers, footnotes, textboxes, etc.

examples.description: Add a paragraph with text to the main document body
Get all bookmarks in the document and display their names in the console
Retrieve the current change tracking mode of the document and display whether only the user's changes, everyone's changes, or no changes are being tracked.
Set the maximum number of consecutive lines that can end with hyphens to 2 to improve document readability

properties.name: contentControls
properties.description: Gets the collection of content control objects in the document. This includes content controls in the body of the document, headers, footers, textboxes, etc.

examples.description: Find and highlight all content controls in the document by changing their background color to yellow

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the document's request context to synchronize changes and load properties from the Word document.

properties.name: customXmlParts
properties.description: Gets the custom XML parts in the document.

examples.description: Retrieve and log the count of custom XML parts in the document to verify if any custom XML data exists.
Retrieve and display the number of saved versions available for the current document in the SharePoint document library.
Get all frames in the document and log their count to the console
Get all hyperlinks in the document and display their text and URLs in the console
Disable hyphenation for capitalized words in the document
Access and retrieve all indexes in the document to check if any indexes exist and get the count of indexes.
Check if the document's language has been automatically detected and display the result to the user
Configure the document's page margins to 1 inch on all sides and set the page orientation to landscape

properties.name: properties
properties.description: Gets the properties of the document.

examples.description: Retrieve and display all built-in document properties from the current Word document.

properties.name: saved
properties.description: Indicates whether the changes in the document have been saved. A value of true indicates that the document hasn't changed since it was saved.

examples.description: Check if the document has unsaved changes and display an alert to the user before proceeding with an operation

properties.name: sections
properties.description: Gets the collection of section objects in the document.

examples.description: Add a page break between each section in the document by inserting a continuous section break at the end of each section except the last one.

properties.name: settings
properties.description: Gets the add-in's settings in the document.

examples.description: Retrieve and display all custom settings that the add-in has stored in the current Word document.

properties.name: windows
properties.description: Gets the collection of `Word.Window` objects for the document.

examples.description: Get the number of windows currently open for the document and display it in the console.

methods.name: addStyle
methods.description: Adds a style into the document by name and type.

examples.description: Add a new custom style to the Word document with a user-specified name and type, after verifying that no style with that name already exists.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes the current document.

examples.description: Close the current Word document with default behavior based on its current state.

methods.name: compare
methods.description: Displays revision marks that indicate where the specified document differs from another document.

examples.description: Compare the current Word document with an external document specified by file path and display the differences in the current document without detecting format changes.

methods.name: compareFromBase64
methods.description: Displays revision marks that indicate where the specified document differs from another document.

examples.description: Compare the current document with a base document stored as a base64 string and display revision marks showing the differences

methods.name: deleteBookmark
methods.description: Deletes a bookmark, if it exists, from the document.

examples.description: Delete a bookmark named "Section1Start" from the document if it exists

methods.name: detectLanguage
methods.description: Note

examples.description: Detect the language of all text content in the document to identify what language the user has written in

methods.name: getAnnotationById
methods.description: Gets the annotation by ID. Throws an `ItemNotFound` error if annotation isn't found.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the text of a specific annotation by its ID "annotation123"

methods.name: getBookmarkRange
methods.description: Gets a bookmark's range. Throws an `ItemNotFound` error if the bookmark doesn't exist.

examples.description: Highlight and modify the text content within a bookmark named "CompanyName" in the document.

methods.name: getBookmarkRangeOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets a bookmark's range. If the bookmark doesn't exist, then this method will return an object with its `isNullObject` property set to `true`. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.

examples.description: Check if a bookmark named "Introduction" exists in the document and highlight its text in yellow if found, otherwise log that it doesn't exist.

methods.name: getContentControls
methods.description: Gets the currently supported content controls in the document.

examples.description: Toggle the checked state of all checkbox content controls in the document.

methods.name: getEndnoteBody
methods.description: Gets the document's endnotes in a single body.

examples.description: Add a new paragraph with text to the document's endnotes section

methods.name: getFootnoteBody
methods.description: Gets the document's footnotes in a single body.

examples.description: Add a new paragraph with text to the document's footnotes body.

methods.name: getParagraphByUniqueLocalId
methods.description: Gets the paragraph by its unique local ID. Throws an `ItemNotFound` error if the collection is empty.

examples.description: Retrieve and display a paragraph from the document using its unique local identifier obtained from user input.

methods.name: getSelection
methods.description: Gets the current selection of the document. Multiple selections aren't supported.

examples.description: Insert explanatory text about the insert text method at the end of the current selection in the document.

methods.name: getStyles
methods.description: Gets a StyleCollection object that represents the whole style set of the document.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the total count of styles available in the Word document.

methods.name: importStylesFromJson
methods.description: Import styles from a JSON-formatted string.

examples.description: Import custom character, paragraph, and table styles into a Word document from a JSON string containing style definitions with formatting properties.

methods.name: insertFileFromBase64
methods.description: Inserts a document into the target document at a specific location with additional properties. Headers, footers, watermarks, and other section properties are copied by default.

examples.description: Replace the current document content with content from a Base64-encoded external document file while importing its theme, styles, paragraph spacing, page color, change tracking mode, custom properties, custom XML parts, and different odd/even page settings.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call `context.sync()` before reading the properties.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the ID, text content, and tag properties of all content controls in the document, or indicate if no content controls exist.

methods.name: manualHyphenation
methods.description: Note

examples.description: Enable manual hyphenation for the document to allow users to manually insert hyphens at line breaks

methods.name: save
methods.description: Saves the document.

examples.description: Check if the document has unsaved changes and save it if necessary, logging the appropriate status message.
Save the current Word document with its default save behavior.

methods.name: search
methods.description: Performs a search with the specified search options on the scope of the whole document. The search results are a collection of range objects.

examples.description: Find all occurrences of the word "TODO" in the document and highlight them in yellow

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

examples.description: Configure multiple document properties at once, including setting the document title and subject metadata

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript `toJSON()` method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to `JSON.stringify()`. (`JSON.stringify`, in turn, calls the `toJSON` method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original `Word.Document` object is an API object, the `toJSON` method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as `Word.Interfaces.DocumentData`) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Serialize a Word document's properties to JSON format for logging or debugging purposes

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across `.sync` calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Get a document reference, track it to prevent "InvalidObjectPath" errors across multiple sync calls, and read its properties multiple times in separate sync operations.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call `context.sync()` before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Load a document object to read its properties, then untrack it to free memory after use
